fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-424].
  {panel}

*Story*
As planners and users, we need to be able to see issue keys in the graphical schedule, so that we can easily identify the issues in the schedule.

This is really hard at the moment, as our teams always refer to issues by key, not summary. 

The schedule, which is a huge part of the value of Portfolio, is not very useful to us without this, and is hampering adoption.

*Suggested solution*
- Add a 'Show issue links' checkbox in the cog on the bottom-right (or make it a global configuration option).
- This checkbox would only be effective in Stories, Epics or Initiatives modes in the graphical schedule.
- If the checkbox is ticked, the issue summaries are prefixed with the issue key if a link exists, and the link points to the JIRA issue.

I would like to see the issue links directly in the bar representing the story/epic/initiative, not in the mouseover as that would mean hovering over each issue to identify it.
fields.summary: Show issue keys/links in graphical schedule
Allow individual releases priorization among different streams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-421].
  {panel}

I want to be able to define a set of rules to assign default estimates based on work item properties.
E.g. : add one story point on stage "Accessibility Testing" if:
* the work item has a certain theme, or
* the work item title contains a certain keyword, or
* the linked JIRA issue has a certain custom field.
fields.summary: Add default estimates in JPO based on work item properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-420].
  {panel}

When importing multiple issues (from multiple projects) into JPO it would be nice to have the ability to choose which team should be allocated to work on which project.

E.g.: 
- On Plan A, I have:
-- team1
-- team2
-- team3. 

- I'm importing issues from:
-- Project1
-- Project2
-- Project3. 

When this import is made, I don't want team1 working on Project2 or Project3 (and so on). So, it would be nice if I could configure this. :)
fields.summary: Allow users to select teams to work on projects when importing issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-416].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

WORSE, when I apply updates to JIRA Portfolio it goes as sets the old fixVersion value back on the issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-409].
  {panel}

Having a scrum team and calculating with story points I want to be able to define a story point supply for every resource.
Currently JPO only supports the velocity definition for the whole team.

h2. *Workaround:*
You can adjust weekly hours as a proxy to reflect story points per team member.
The proportion of weekly hours per team member equates to the proportion of story points assigned to members from the pool of team points.

*E.g: Team X has 30 pts*
Case 1:
Member A - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member B - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member C - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts

Case 2:
Member A - 60 weekly hrs = 15 pts
Member B - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member C - 20 weekly hrs = 5 pts
fields.summary: Define story point supply per resource
Define story point supply per resource

fields.summary: NullPointerException in LinkEnrichmentData.create while importing large numbers of backlog issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-406].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create JPO plan (even with sample data)
# Go to Reports by Releases > select any version
# Filter by Stories

*Expected Results:*
# Stories should show up just like epics do.
E.g. Epics:

*Actual Results:*
# Nothing shows up

*Workaround:*
None at this point.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v6.5-OD-07
JIRA Portfolio v1.10.1-OD-002
fields.summary: Display Stories content on Report by Releases
define skills in team basis
"Update from date" no longer pulls in JIRA Issue changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-403].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

When I import issues in Jira Portfolio, I would like to import assignees that already exist on Jira tasks and user stories. 

Some fields are already filled when we "Import issues" : Parent epics and releases. It would be great to also have the assignee filled because very often, when we create tasks in Jira, we already know who will have to work on each task (but we don't know when). And the problem is that when you import dozens of tasks in Portfolio, that were already assigned in Jira, you have to reassign (to force the assignment) all these tasks manually in Portfolio (and so you have to make the assignment job twice).

So, the "import issues" panel could allow to have more columns such as "Assignee" and why not "Sprint" (because sometimes, when importing a task in Portfolio, we already know in which sprint we want to affect this task).

Thank you.
fields.summary: Allow to import assignee when importing issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-398].
  {panel}

Hi

I am helping with setup of Portfolio for my business unit. We have a lot of teams with various skills, and we often get assigned tasks that will only fit into the skill set of a few persons on a specific team. 

An example: A task (epic) has been assigned to my team. I have linked the epic to my backlog and estimated it to 10 days. The task only targets Skill 1 in our cross-functional team:
!1.png|thumbnail!

We have 5 skills, and skill 1 is, by default, set to 20%. I now want to make skill 1 accountable for 100%. You cannot punch in '100%', so I enter '100':
!2.png|thumbnail!

But now the full estimate is 100 days. Of course, I could the just enter 10, but that still interferes with the idea of making Portfolio driven by the data in the backlog.

Would it be possible to allow for entering percentages in the skill fields? However, I am not sure if this is the best solution for the problem. If I have a task with 70% Skill 1 and 30% Skill 2, it would be possible to slot it in using the idea above. But as time progresses and, say, the Skill 1 part estimate increase due to whatever, this will also affect the percentage of the estimate that goes to Skill 2.
fields.summary: Stages and percentages

fields.description:
Was trying out Jira Portfolio (Plugin build: 1.9.4) for a long-running team using our in-house version of Jira (not cloud)

JIRA Title: Sonatype JIRA
JIRA Edition: enterprise
JIRA Version: 6.4.4

#  imported 3 releases from a Jira Agile project, then 
# set up a single team under people tab and immediately got an error when trying to set velocity.

Nothing else was setup and none of the backlog had been imported yet.

Could not clear this error.  A team member tried to set up something similar in another JP plan for the same team and received different error messages.

Suggestions?  Error message below.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-391].
  {panel}

It would be helpful to add estimates to Epics or Stories and specify the burdown rate.

For example, If I have a release that is a fixed duration of 3 months. I have project management Epics and/or stories that need to be estimated and applied across the duration of the project.

A PM may estimate 100 hours of project management across the 3 month duration.

Today, this can be handled by setting up weekly project management stories across the duration of the project, but that is somewhat of an arduous task.

But, having a setting for applying a burndown rate would be helpful.
fields.summary: A new feature for slowing the burndown on issues would be helpful.
As a Project Manager, I want to be able to import Jira User Stories into Portfolio without having to assign an epic.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-389].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

The "Dependent story constraint" can be confusing, and it can result in JIRA Portfolio calculating impossible schedules.

h2. Suggestion

The feature should be documented and labeled better.  It appears to only apply to scrum teams but apparently it's relevant to any kind of team?

h2. Background

I'm planning a small milestone with a few tasks distributed between two teams.  Our hours-per-day setting is set to six hours.  In the attached image, you can see the time estimates.  There are four tasks (not stories, does it matter?) that depend on one another:

* Final QA (1 hour), depends on:
* QA fixes (4 hours), depends on:
* QA testing (2 hours), depends on:
* Mailer implementation (12 hours)

Those four issues form a critical path that will take at least 17 total hours.  JIRA Portfolio calculated a schedule that says that we should be able to accomplish all four of those things in one six-hour day.

That's impossible.

!Engineering_-_JIRA_Portfolio_-_JIRA.jpg|width=600px!
fields.summary: Calculated an impossible schedule

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-388].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes an issue will be manually assigned to a developer (through the JIRA issue view). As JIRA Portfolio currently only allows synchronization of:
* Summary
* Description
* Estimation

Whenever the changes to the plan are pushed to the projects the assignee of those issues will be overwritten, and data may be lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
When an issue is assigned to an user, the assignee would be added as a member of the linked story on the plan.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like JIRA Portfolio to synchronize the assignee of stories

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-387].

Morning Martin,

Request to support wiki markup (or RTE) on the epic description. We're looking to either link to a product brief in Confluence and/or write a short summary in the product brief. Having formatting would be helpful for parsing the description.

Thanks,
 Nick

 

 
 *Steps to reproduce:*
 1. Create a new Epic using multiple text formatting at the Description, for instance:
{code:java}
h3. test
 * one
 * two

{color:#FF0000}red{color}

:)
{code}
The visual of this text:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 20.08.38.png|width=599,height=457!

2. Create a new Plan for the Project Area where the new Epic was created
 3. Create a new Program using the new Plan created
 4. The new Program will show a list of all the Initiative/Epics of the Project, including the new Epic
 5. Click at the new Epic to visualize it at the right side of the page

*Expected behavior*
 Read the Description with the text formatted

*What is presented instead*
 The text view of the Description, without formatting
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 20.09.30.png|width=756,height=380!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*JIRA Portfolio* does not allow non administrator users to manage the *Portfolio » Administration* page when [Secure Administration Sessions (WebSudo)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions] is enabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.5
* JIRA Portfolio 1.9.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA with JIRA Portfolio
# Create a new user (e.g. "projectmaster");
# Create a new group for the Administrators of Portfolio (e.g. "jira-portfolio-administrators");
# Add "projectmaster" to "jira-portfolio-administrators";
# Navigate to *Portfolio » Administration* and add the "jira-portfolio-administrators" group to the Administrator role.
# Log in with the "projectmaster" user;
# Try to access *Portfolio » Administration;
# A login page will be displayed, stating the the user does not have permission to view page.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to see the Portfolio Administration page.

h3. Actual Results
The user would is redirected to the "WebSudo" screen, which is redirecting the user to the Login page (as the user is not an administrator and hence should not see the websudo page).

h3.Workaround
Follow the [Configuring Secure Administrator Sessions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions#ConfiguringSecureAdministratorSessions-DisablingSecureAdministratorSessions] to disable websudo.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-365].
  {panel}

While utilizing Story Points for Portfolio planning and performing a plan update, it automatically sets Completed stories to 0.

This is unexpected behavior, and has ramifications for users of JIRA Agile when a Story's points are changed mid-sprint
In addition, our users are disgruntled when a Story that they completed which they thought difficult was set to 0. It tells them that story wasn't difficult.

We use Story Points as "Difficulty", which translates to "Time Estimated". We have never used Story Points as "Time Remaining".

We have the existing work-around of undoing all of the estimated changes, this is time consuming.

As a suggestion, allow an option to disable setting Completed task's Story Points field to 0.
Instead, have the Plan understand that completed tasks have an "effective" story point of 0, without changing the field.

This setting should probably be the default for users of Story Points.
fields.summary: Option for "Update from Date" to not set Completed task's Story Points to 0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-364].
  {panel}

With our implementation of the portfolio and Jira Agile we have created a particular mapping between estimates on custom sub tasks to the estimates on the 'skills' in the portfolio. Note we are using time to estimate effort. For example we have custom sub tasks 'Design', 'Development' & 'Testing' that link to skills of the same name in the portfolio. 

Once a portfolio epic becomes 'live' we would like to link an actual epic in Jira with which then aggregate sum of the relevant sub task types would flow back into the portfolio 'skill' estimates in the portfolio. Effectively the ownership of the estimates now moves to the implementation of the epic in Jira. This now gives us a 'live' constraint based view of the skill estimates as they vary during the implementation phase, eg the test estimate doubles and the test skill become a visual bottle neck in the portfolio. We are often coupled to skill shortages in our workflow, etc.

In the current portfolio documentation there is a suggestion to use the story breakdown to create a separate story for each skill and just use title string to describe. We could do this but we find this data model less obvious than using specific sub task types for the skills. Also a single story neatly contains all the effort estimation in this model, avoiding a proliferation of stories under an epic. I should note also we like the portfolio be a lean with just epics that link to the Jira epic and avoid duplicating too much data, the drill down is always possible with the issue link.

So the question is would this 'sub task type' to 'skill' mapping be something worth considering in the portfolio product when setting up synchronization?

If not it would be great to have a basic API on the portfolio to allow us to scripts this custom synchronization we desire properly. At the moment we actually have this working with some custom scripting that interacts with the Jira API and SQL db for the portfolio (gasp), updates once a day. This was really just our proof of concept ;)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-360].
  {panel}

Hi, 

  Im currently evaluating the use of JIRA Portfolio to use it for the planning of our sprints.

   I was assigning new Epics and stories with some teams. When I clicked on recalculate and went to the scheduled it showed "unexpected exception". Not sure how to "fix" it. so Im writting to you to see if it can be fixeds. Below the description of the error. Thanks!

error in variable slot function

fields.summary: Found a Bug/Error while trying to access Scheduler

fields.description:
Because of JPO-14/JPO-358, we can't import all our tickets in one go.

When we import 100 tickets out of the thousands we have, it creates a "default epic" named "New Epic - Imported".

The documents I've found (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioCloud/Adding+Existing+Issues+to+Your+Plan, under "Importing other issue types") say you can assign a default epic.  But the behaviour is the same if you type in a specific epic name.

The warning message message (attachment the first in JPO-358) says to repeat the import again to get more than 100 issues added.

This document (the FAQ: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioCloud/Importing,+Syncing+and+Updating#Importing,SyncingandUpdating-Whenimportingfromfilters,isthatdynamicdataorstaticatthemomentofimport?) says that you can re-run the import with the same query as other runs, but, well, you get the same behaviour.

Since most of our tickets aren't in an epic, this means having to click on EACH ONE and "assign" it to the original default Epic.

I'm filing this as a bug, since if you specify an existing Epic for "Default Epic Name", is should use that existing epic, and not make a duplicate, identically named epic.
fields.summary: Multiple Default Epics Created
Import more than 100 issues -- Still a limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-357].
  {panel}

We'd like to be able to group the Epic Roadmap views by additional criteria. Today the only grouping options are None, Team and Member. We'd like to also group by things like Product or Delivery Mechanism (Web, Desktop, Mobile, etc.).

Here is the use cases: 
* We want to show a roadmap by Product, but currently our teams are not a 1 to 1 relationship with Product. We could have more than 1 team on a product or share teams across products. We're currently using Team to represent Product for a product roadmap, but would love to use team as the actual scrum teams to take advantage of the capacity planning elements.
* We also have a need to show roadmaps by Delivery Mechanism as we have goals of investing in some more than others.

I'm sure as we use this, we'll think of more uses. The ultimate would be to allow us to customize which fields to group on and allow multiple Epic views to exist simultaneously with different groupings.

Thanks!

[~aentler]
fields.summary: Additional ways of grouping Epic roadmap/Gantt chart view in Jira Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-356].
  {panel}

See related task JPO-190 - 'calculate release' returns a start and end date in the past.

The workaround provided by Atlassian was to enter a current or future date in the 'Earliest Start' field, which I have been doing. (I still believe that it should not be necessary for the user to manually enter an appropriate start date to get around this system error.)

I have noticed that since upgrading to Portfolio 1.9.4, when I enter an earliest start date, the dynamic release start date typically returns a date the same as the earliest start date - there seems to be little or no correlation between the calculated release start date and the number of epics (with corresponding time estimates) prioritised higher than the epic in question.

Does the prioritisation of epics actually do anything?

Please help!

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

When releases are linked with versions in JIRA, and a different version is assigned to a JIRA issue, JIRA Portfolio should automatically suggest the new release when doing a "Plan > Update from date" operation
fields.summary: Plan Update - Automatically suggest changed release assignments
Allow comments on stories created in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-350].
  {panel}

{code}
Exception timestamp: 1431545652817

java.lang.RuntimeException :error in variable slot function {code}

Error when assigning team members to stage. 

h2. Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new scrum plan: “Test Plan”
2. Configure Stages and Skills
* Stage 1
** Skill 11
** Skill 12
** Skill 13

* Stage 2
* * Skill 21
* * Skill 22
* * Skill 23

3. Create Team and assign some members
* Team 1

4. Import backlog
5. Assign Stages to Team (find screen-shot)

Click on "Recalculate" and get the following error message.

{noformat}
Exception timestamp: 1431545652817

java.lang.RuntimeException :error in variable slot function

  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.trafo.teams.common.sprints.VariableScrumWorkSlots.findInIrregulars:69
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.trafo.teams.common.sprints.VariableScrumWorkSlots.getSlotOrNextForTimeStep:50
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.scheduling.data.resources.ResourceGroup.getSlotOrNextForTimeStep:123
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.retrafo.stats.ScheduleStatisticsProvider.getPartialSlotData:79
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.retrafo.stats.ScheduleStatisticsProvider.calculateScheduleStatistics:63
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.retrafo.solution.RoadmapToPlanSolutionTransformer.transform:49
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.LocalCalculationProcess.execute:109
  at com.radiantminds.roadmap.common.scheduling.Calculation$2.run:135
  at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call:511
  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run:266
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker:1142
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run:617
  at java.lang.Thread.run:745
{noformat}

h2. Workaround 1
Make sure at least one of your epics or stories can be scheduled, which means it must have an estimation and there must be at least one team available with members providing the needed skills.

h2.Workaround 2
If workaround 1 does not work, additionally adding another release in the stream, will clear out the error in some cases

fields.description:
When the progress method of a plan is set to _Resolved issue count_ in _Plan > Configure > Progress > Progress tracking_, the CSV export causes an error and the plan is not exported.

*Workaround:* In order to make the export work, the progress can be switched to another tracker before exporting and can then be switched back to _Resolved issue count_ again.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-344].
  {panel}

Actually there are only two permissions available: Editors & Viewers.

We operate hundreds of developers in dozens of teams plus all kind of managers (roles): 
- Ressource managers (Team leads)
- Portfolio managers
- Capacity managers
- Product owners
- Requirement enginieers

There for we request more dedicated permissions that we can activate/de-activate per user and/or group but especially on data objects:
- Team
- User
- Initiative
- Story
- Release

Thank in advance.
fields.summary: Dedicated Permissions on Data Object Level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-343].
  {panel}

*Summary*
When using the "update from date" functionality, completed items have their story point estimate removed on the JIRA issues. The portfolio keeps the original estimate, but losing the estimate on JIRA issues is causing problems with JIRA reports as the story points are completely removed.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Import a story with story points into JIRA portfolio
# Set the story in JIRA to "Closed"
# In JIRA portfolio, run the "Update from date" action using the current date
# Find the story and JIRA and note that it's story points have been removed
# Go to the JIRA "version" report and note that the story points have also been removed here, which skews the version report

*Expected Behavior*
Story points should never be removed from the JIRA issues when marked as complete in JIRA portfolio. It is desirable to keep the points for history within JIRA, and also to properly populate the JIRA reports.
fields.summary: Allow disabling estimate suggestions in "Update from date"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-342].
  {panel}

JIRA Portfolio imports Epic Summary, but then synchronizes back by over-writing into Epic Name. Synchronization would import and update, back and forth, to and from the same field. It should not change what field it imports from and updates to.

*Current behavior*
JIRA Portfolio displays the JIRA Epic Summary as the JIRA Portfolio Title when synchronizing

*Requested behavior*
JIRA Portfolio displays the JIRA Epic summary as the JIRA Portfolio title when synchronizing
fields.summary: Update how JIRA synchronizes Epics so the Portfolio Title becomes the Jira Epic Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-341].
  {panel}

Currently, if there are too many epics in the backlog sometime it is difficult for them to identify these items, it would be best if we had an option to to define the colors for each epic separately, based on the team allocated or derived from the respective initiative.

As an administrator, I think it would be valuable to be able to color code initiatives and epics, as it would make it easier to locate specific epics when there are quite a few in a plan. A few examples of how we could customise the color are:

To be able to set or select a colour to represent Initiatives and Epics.
When an Initiative colour is set, apply that colour by default to the Epics in the Initiative.
Sync the colours between Portfolio and JIRA.
fields.summary: Define custom colors for epics and initiatives
UX Change -> Swap Epic and Initiative buttons around

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-339].
  {panel}

We would like to have visibility / be able to break down tasks underneath stories from the scheduler view, this would probably not need to be visible all the time (collapsed) but being able to view something like this would be invaluable in breaking things down:

Epic
-----| MyStory
-----------------|<Collapsed Tasks>
-----|MyBug

As currently when we create the items in the view, tasks & stories get lumped together at the same level
fields.summary: Allow portfolio scheduling view to reflect hierachy between Epic->Story->Tasks
Please provide link to JIRA issues in "Gantt Chart"
Add Links to Issue in JIRA in the Reports view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-336].
  {panel}

'Apply update to projects' allows the creation of issue links based on the issue link types configured in JIRA. At the moment, the issue link type has to be set up in the following way in order to be created correctly (this is only an example, the wording can be adapted to your likes, of course):

*Name* // *Outward Description* // *Inward Description*
_Dependency_ // _blocks_ // _depends on_

That is, the outward description has to describe the blocking aspect of the relation while the inward description describes the depending / blocked by aspect. Issue links can be configured as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue+Linking].

In order to make it easier for users to get issue links created the way they want, Portfolio should allow to configure the direction of the issue links created.
fields.summary: Allow to configure issue link type direction for Portfolio dependencies

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* In JIRA Portfolio, add a dependency to a story (Story A requires Story B)
* Run "Apply updates to project/s" for this story, selecting "Depends" as the Issue link type
* In JIRA, observe that Story B "depends on" Story A.

Expected behaviour:
* In JIRA, Story A should depend on Story B.
fields.summary: "Depends" link is wrong way round

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-334].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The current functionality of JIRA Portfolio allows for Sprint Dates And Release Dates to become out-of-sync, this can cause Stories to be scheduled outside the Release dates, into the 'Later' releases, having sprints with no Stories.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Releases that have Fixed End dates that do not correlate with the Sprint dates.
# Recalculate
# Select the "Stories" Icon. 

h3. Expected Results
An option to Sync up the Sprints would be nice, or some way to make it clear why there are empty Sprints. Alternatively, a default behaviour to start the release as early as possible to prevent empty sprints.

h3. Actual Results
It's not clear how the releases affect the arrangement of Stories into Sprints.

h3. Workaround
Adjust Sprints to start earlier than the calculated date by using "X Days _Before_" the previous release date for the start dates of Sprints.
fields.summary: Make Reason for Empty Sprints More obvious

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-333].
  {panel}

Currently, Portfolio does not offer separate fields to represent an Agile Epic's name and summary, both fields are represented by the Epic title in Portfolio.

*Current behaviour:*
When applying updates to linked Projects and and enabling summary syncing, the title configured in Portfolio is set to summary and name of the linked Agile Epic. The same goes for automatic two-way synchronization of summaries between JIRA and Portfolio. Changing either Epic name or summary in JIRA will propagate the new value to Portfolio. Changing the title in Portfolio will set Epic name and summary in JIRA.

*Desired behaviour:*
Portofolio provides a separate field for the Epic name (e.g., in the details page of a backlog item) and maps the title to the Epic summary. This way, the two fields could be synced independently and a change to the Epic title in Portfolio would then not unexpectedly overwrite the Epic name in JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow to manage Epic name and summary independently in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-332].
  {panel}

When I create a new plan and import issues into that plan, I want any story points that were defined in my issues to carry over into my new plan.

*Current behavior*
When a user creates a new plan in JIRA Portfolio and proceeds to import issues into the plan, any story points that were included on the original issue do not show up in the plan.

*Requested behavior*
When a user creates a new plan in JIRA Portfolio and proceeds to import issues into the plan, any story points that were included on the original issue show up in the plan.
fields.summary: When importing issues from JIRA, story points should carry over

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-331].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is possible to synchronize the estimation between *JIRA Agile* and *JIRA Portfolio* when the same field is used for estimation on both. As it is possible to estimate using a custom field in *JIRA Agile* - but not in *JIRA Portfolio* - the synchronization will not work.

Also, different teams may use different estimates on different *Plans*, which is not something currently possible with JIRA Portfolio.

h3. Suggested Solution
* JIRA Portfolio would have a default *Estimation*.
* The *Estimation* could be configured per plan.
* The *Estimation* would accept values of "Number" custom fields.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to estimate using custom fields
JIRA Portfolio overwrites Epic Name when synchronizing with JIRA Agile

fields.description:
Hi,

When you set up a dependency between two stories in JIRA Portfolio, and then propagate those back to JIRA using Apply Updates to Projects, I think that it might be creating the Dependency link in the wrong direction.

In Image 1, you can see that I have set up Story 2 so that it depends on Story 1.

In Image 2, I can see that Story 2 is implemented after Story 1, even though Story 2 appears at the top of the backlog.

In Image 3, you can see my settings for propagating the link back to the JIRA issues.

In Image 4, you can see that Story 2 blocks Story 1, which I interpret to mean that Story 1 can't get started until Story 2 is finished.  Assuming that I am interpreting "blocks" correctly, this is the reverse order.
fields.summary: Apply Updates to Projects creates Dependency links in reverse direction
Provide the option to schedule on a daily basis for Scrum teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-325].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

Sub-tasks should be supported in Portfolio and should also be displayed in the backlog table as child elements of stories. This would allow for a better JIRA integration. At the moment, Portfolio does not really have a notion of sub-tasks, their estimates are considered in the 'Update from date...' estimate suggestions, but they are not respected when syncing estimates back to JIRA, which then potentially adds the sub-tasks estimates to the parent story.

Thus, it is desirable to manage sub-tasks of stories in the same way as stories are treated within epics.
fields.summary: Fully integrate JIRA sub-tasks into Portfolio

fields.description:
*How to reproduce:*

* Turn on estimate syncing for epics in Portfolio (Plan > Configure > Synchronization)
* Set the planning mode to days (Plan > Configure > Scheduling)
* Create an epic in Portfolio and link it to an issue in JIRA
* Set the original and remaining estimate on the JIRA issue (e.g., 5d)
* Log work on the JIRA issue (e.g., 2d which gives a remaining estimate of 3d)
* Open the 'Update from date...' dialog in Portfolio (Plan > Update from date)
* The epics estimate is suggested to be reduced to 3d - so far, so good
* Discard the update
* Reopen the 'Update from date...' dialog
* *No suggestion is shown*
* *Also, when checking the remaining estimate on the linked JIRA issue, it has been reset to 5*

*Work around: * Disable estimate syncing before opening the 'Update from date' dialog
fields.summary: Opening 'Update from date...' dialog sets remaining estimates on linked JIRA issues, no suggestions shown
